reviews.review_msg: Joe is an extremely energetic professor with a good taste in fashion. His lectures are half informative and half group activities. With his course layout, you can learn anything you want as long as you use cognitive theory to explain what you're doing.

TOUGH GRADER. Due to Covid-19 the lecture is being delivered online. His lecture is very short. 15-20 minutes per chapter. HOWEVER, exam is insanely difficult. You'd better memorize every single word on your textbook. He does not teach much but exam covers broad amount of knowledge.

His teaching style was very boring. More than half the class would just leave midway because it was hard to pay attention with his teaching style. Last exam was cumulative, so it was very difficult and a lot to remember. It was hard for me to stay awake in this class because he was not fun to listen to.

Based on Fall 2019 semester: Exceptional prof, have taken other classes with him, passionate. His lectures are discussion based but he gives the option to respond on an online poll. Five critical papers to write based on readings (450 words). Clear grading criteria. TA gave good marks and every paper deadline was extended.

There is a small quiz or an assignment due each class so you can't skip, but if you pay attention and follow instructions you'll be fine. Enjoyable course, Joe is super nice and attentive, acts like he wants to be there which makes a difference.
This course shouldn't be viewed as a GPA booster. If you want to formalize your understanding of how to learn and can commit to it, you will do fine.
Hes very caring, just recall the primary objectives and the secondary objectives and youll pass along with the essay assignment cut in three parts makes it much useful

lectures are well put and well executed, really good at explaining. The only downside is the mastery quizzes are worth 73% of your grade, and in order to get full marks you need 90% and above, and half marks is 83% and above. Mastering them isn't hard, just make flashcards and MEMORIZE them, it's not heavy concept and is easy to memorize.
In case my first rating didn't go through, check out "A COGS 110 Rant/Reflection" on the SFU Reddit for my thoughts on COGS 110 with Joe Thompson for the Spring 2019 Semester.

Great prof, he is always available for help outside of class. Lectures were at 8:30 and not have I once felt bored or tired. Makes the concepts super clear and easy to understand. The course however, is marked based off mastery (worth 72% of your grade and you must achieve a 90% of higher for full marks on tests. A very stressful class, great prof
He is actually a great guy, the course is just very different from other courses. You will find him answering questions of students and he actually wants to help you
Good prof. Learned a lot in his class. If you go to class you'll do fine. Would recommend.
He is very helpful and extends his office hours. Does his best.

The things taught in this course will help you throughout your university studies. Although I just finished the COGS110 course, it isn't the end of COGS110 for me. This was the only course which I felt comfortable and confident in and has helped my studying for the better. I truly recommend this class to anyone. Joe has really inspired me.

LITERALLY WILL MAKE OR BREAK YOUR GPA. HE REMARKS SOME OF THE MASTERY TESTS AND NOT THE OTHERS WHICH IS SO UNFAIR TO THE STUDENTS THAT DIDNT PASS ONE BUT PASSED THE OTHER AND LITERALLY SOME OF IT IS SO DUMB LIKE IN ONE SECTIONS ITS THIS AND THEN IN THE OTHER HE GOES BACK ON IT.
Easy marker. GPA booster. Constantly scaling quizes and assignments so grades go way up. Marks papers very quickly and gives good marks.

The course definitely needs to be re-evaluted on its grading scale since it is absolutely unfair. You need 90% on each of the 8 tests to pass the test or else you fail the test BEWARE OF THAT. I strongly regret taking this course as an elective. Joe is overall, an okay prof BUT this course I do not recommend. Not a GPA BOOSTER. Dont fool yourself.

He cares and understands students. He is also willing to extend office hours to answer questions, and I found the course to be easy with his help. Would recommend him for someone who is interested in taking COGS 110.

Joe is easily one of the worst profs I have had in my time at university. He is a VERY HARD test maker, and he has a very large superiority complex. I would stay and talk to him all the time, but the questions he asks are so much more complex and much harder compared to the material that he presents in class and he LOVES trick questions. Be wary.

Worst professor I have ever encountered, please for your GPA and mental sanity take cogs110 at Burnaby and avoid the Surrey class like the plague. I really dislike describing an academic in such a negative light but he is genuinely an idiot. I've never been so disgusted with a teacher's style of teaching.

Joe is a disorganized and unclear professor. The course material is pretty easy and very interesting, but he makes it all unecessarily harder with his weekly quizzes. Not only is his grammar flawed on them, but he often had trouble answering students questions. Hes unreasonable with grading and doesnt believe in rounding %. Avoid him if you can.

I don't think i learned a single thing from this class. I don't get what Joe was trying to teach us every week for 3 hours but it was clearly not a history class like i thought. He lectured about absolutely nothing, must just like the sound of his voice. He also moves deadlines around without any notice and adds quizzes to the syllabus throughout.
He's a nice person but grading scheme of this course sucks. So there's nothing he or u can do about it.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! EVEN IF YOU THINK YOU CAN, NO MATTER HOW MUCH THE PROF PERSUADES YOU THAT IF YOU STUDY HARD AND EFFICIENTLY YOU WILL PASS DO NOT BELIEVE HIM. I WOULD SACRIFICE MY LIFE IF IT MEANT I COULD SAVE STUDENTS FROM TAKING THIS COURSE. DO NOT DO IT! EVEN THOUGH THE MATERIAL IS INTERESTING IT'S NOT WORTH IT. I'D GIVE A ZERO RATING

Lectures were upbeat and interesting. As long as you complete the primary and secondary objectives, you'll get a good grade. There's an essay assignment thats broken up into three parts making it much more bearable.

Clear on grading criteria and what to focus on for exams. Not intimidating to approach for questions, and goes above and beyond to answer questions. If youre shy, he does polleverywhere so you can still contribute to discussions. Lectures are really interesting, as he only goes in depth on important concepts. Overall, i really enjoyed his class!
He really goes above and beyond to help students with their assignments especially when he helped fix my assignment by giving feedback on how to fix it.

Despite the long lectures and readings, I really enjoyed this class. I found the prof to be very friendly, upbeat, and caring. He wants for everybody to do good in his class. An easy A as long as you read and study from the study guides he provides. Assignments are a breeze.
Great teacher-- makes the course bearable

Very passionate about the subject and is very willing to speak with you outside of class to help you succeed. However, the difference between an A and A+ will be determined by your group for the video project (choose wisely). Put in the effort and you will be rewarded.

Took COGS 110 with Joe and he was a solid prof. The course itself is very easy so long as you show up and put in minimal effort. He does a lot of participation marks on canvas so attendance is mandatory for those grades. He was a very forgiving marker and gave a lot of bonus marks where he felt grades were too low on average. Highly recommend.

He is very passionate about the material and the course is ACTUALLY useful in real life for everyone. It is not an easy course, but I would recommend to take it with him because it will help you in the future whatever you do. He is also very reasonable and accessible for help.

This class and the professor, Joe, seemed a little disorganized. There were lots of typos on assessments and technical errors when trying to submit things on Canvas, which resulted in bonus marks for students, but overall was kind of annoying. Lots of small assignments though, to boost your grade and Joe is genuinely interested in this subject.

Not the best prof ever. I have just had him for this course, but I wasn't impressed. It's so confusing and unclear to take his class. I feel that if you like an organized and focused course, this won't work for you. The class is all over the place, and he isn't very clear as to what he wants. Oh, also a very tough grader.

Joe seems like a nice professor, but don't let that fool you. When it comes to marking assignments, he is very unfair. Although the class is supposed to be about critical thinking, it is not. The way it is goes like this: either you agree with his or the TA's point of view, or you get a lower grade. Not fair regarding grading "though course."
This class ended up being quite beneficial for me in terms of writing papers. Could use a textbook but other than that, I found it challenging and Joe provided great feedback.

Joe is a very inexperienced professor. When it comes to history class, he tends to give extremely difficult to read articles and is extremely hard in marking. Also, he is very unclear as to what he wants. This course is only about critical thinking and knowing about history doesn't matter. I would not recommend. Stay away from him! You'll thank me!
Joe is a great prof, really passionate. He obviously loves his work and wants his students to do well. He makes the lectures interesting, especially when he wears his Dragonball t-shirts.
